questions.q: What does this service do?
questions.a: With one phone call, we handle or organize hospital, administrative, health, and daily living issues for you.

questions.q: Do I need to install an app?
questions.a: No. All you need is a phone.

questions.q: Who is this service for?
questions.a: This is a phone-based life support service for middle-aged and senior individuals living alone.

questions.q: Is it complicated to use?
questions.a: Not at all. Just speak what you need.

questions.q: Am I talking to a human agent?
questions.a: An AI assists you by phone instead of a person.

questions.q: Can I speak slowly?
questions.a: Yes. Speak slowly and comfortably.

questions.q: Does it remember past conversations?
questions.a: Yes. We refer to previous conversations to help you better.

questions.q: Do you make hospital appointments for me?
questions.a: Yes. We call hospitals directly to make appointments or inquiries.

questions.q: Can you call city hall or community centers?
questions.a: Yes. We check procedures, documents, and departments.

questions.q: Do you wait on hold for me?
questions.a: Yes. No waiting or ARS—just results.

questions.q: How do I get the results?
questions.a: We call you back with explanations or summaries.

questions.q: Can I request multiple follow-ups?
questions.a: Yes. We'll call again if you need confirmation.

questions.q: What types of calls can you make?
questions.a: Hospitals, public agencies, and general service inquiries.

questions.q: What if the call doesn't go through?
questions.a: We'll try again or guide you to another solution.

questions.q: Can I tell you about symptoms?
questions.a: Yes. We organize the information for you.

questions.q: Do you tell me if I should see a doctor?
questions.a: We don't diagnose, but we provide guidance on whether a visit is recommended.

questions.q: Do you replace doctor consultations?
questions.a: No. We do not perform medical acts.

questions.q: Do you prepare questions for doctor visits?
questions.a: Yes. We organize necessary questions for you.

questions.q: Can I get help when anxious?
questions.a: Yes. We organize the situation and provide guidance.

questions.q: Are health records kept?
questions.a: Only to the extent necessary for service.

questions.q: Is my status shared with family?
questions.a: Only when necessary, and briefly.

questions.q: Is family always notified?
questions.a: No. Only in unusual situations.

questions.q: Will I feel monitored?
questions.a: No. Autonomy is our top priority.

questions.q: What information is shared?
questions.a: Only minimal information like condition summaries.

questions.q: Can I turn off sharing?
questions.a: Yes. You can adjust settings anytime.

questions.q: Do you block voice phishing?
questions.a: Yes. We detect suspicious calls in real-time.

questions.q: How do you notify me if it's dangerous?
questions.a: Immediately by voice during the call.

questions.q: Do you explain why it's risky?
questions.a: Yes. We provide clear and simple reasons.

questions.q: Do I have to hang up myself?
questions.a: Yes. The decision to hang up is yours.

questions.q: Is family notified?
questions.a: If necessary, we can alert guardians.

questions.q: Do you provide weather and schedules?
questions.a: Yes. Right away by phone.

questions.q: Do you remind me to take medication?
questions.a: Yes. We assist with daily living reminders.

questions.q: What happens in urgent situations?
questions.a: We guide you to immediate help.

questions.q: How do I use the service again?
questions.a: Just call anytime.

questions.q: What's the biggest benefit of this service?
questions.a: You don't have to solve everything alone.

footer.tagline: Alone but not lonely, together with SOLOCALL
